name: places/ChIJt7i-fl1ZwokRUWSoRxmFgCM
formattedAddress: 30 W 30th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 30 W 30th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: If I could give a negative I would. I found what appeared to be as a beautiful hidden gem on TikTok. I made reservations for yesterday night for 2 at 8:30 pm. My friend and I reached the place and saw a group ahead of us. I kindly asked if they were waiting and they were, so we  continued to wait behind them. They soon left and it was just my friend and I. After 5 minutes of waiting a person from the connecting restaurant came out and said “hi do you have reservations” I was about to answer but he was talking directly behind me to a party BEHIND US. I literally stopped and thought there was a confusion. The other party was communicating with the host like we were not there. Hint my friend and I a minority. I didn’t want to be rude but I said with a raised hand “Um, hello, yes we do have. We are standing here and we have reservations for 2 at 8:30” he took both us and the other party down and sent us to another host. Kind of rude. After we told this host our party number he looks around and sees there are no seats and says we are going to have to sit you at the bar. “Because we have a burlesque show and there are a bunch of parties . I said okay I guess. He left us standing in the dark while he “looked for seating “ did not return and after 10min my friend and I left. Terrible service! Will not be returning to an establishment who treats people like this . Oh and that party of 4 who were behind us were seated right away!

originalText.text:
Very nice lounge. Great ambience, atmosphere & spectacular show.  Exquisite drinks! Drinks are $25 & the presentation was amazing. The bartender was attentive & great.

Came here on a Thursday night. Only problem was the show was supposed to start at 8 and it didn't start until 930pm. Wish to have known But still worth it.  Highly recommend.

originalText.text: I'd love to have a review but, unfortunately, we were excited to spend our last night in NYC at a cool place but were called 30 minutes before we were leaving to be told our reservation was cancelled.  We were left to find somewhere else to go on a Friday night in New York City with 4 people. Maybe they are trying to create some "Thief Vibe" in which they act like irresponsible jerks.  If so...doing a great job.

If so...doing a great job.

originalText.text:
Ambiance: Gorgeous and trendy. It feels cozy and luxurious at the same time.

Service: Fairly good. The staff was really nice but I did felt a little rushed to order.

Drinks: Overpriced. It is very expensive especially considering that it just came in a plain glass, nothing fancy. We paid $50 for 2 drinks and they definitely didn't taste or look like $25 drinks. They also didn't have the entire drinks menu to serve which didn't make sense. They only had 4 or 5 of the total 12 drinks listed on the menu.

Experience: We dealt with the manager or owner and he went out of the way to find us new seats when we had stayed past our reservation. They also happened to start a burlesque show and that ended up being a nice bonus to the night. I'd consider going back especially if I got the Pulsd deal because then it's worth it.  Jewel Thief is also on the Seated app, for those who don't have it and download it, use Forum1 for the $15 bonus.

Instagram Handle: @TheShahLALand

originalText.text: What they advertised is not what you get. They claimed that it would be an interactive experience where you would solve mystery. At least that was the package that they sold us for more than $100 each person. We got there and it was just a performer on stage. Expensive drinks and mediocre food.  They don’t know where to seat you.  Once you get seated, they put a time limit on how long you can be there. This place is a scam.  The whole thing was pretty lame.
